input_description.intro:
Purpose of pw2wannier90.x: Interface with wannier90 code to construct maximally localized Wannier functions.
The code reads the nnkp file which is generated by the wannier90.x postprocessing run, (wannier90.x -pp seedname). Then, it computes and writes initial projection, overlap matrices, energy eigenvalues, and several other quantities that are used by the wannier90 code.
Structure of the input data: ============================
&INPUTPP ... /

var.name: prefix
var.info: prefix of files saved by program pw.x

var.name: outdir
var.info: directory containing the input data, i.e. the same as in pw.x
var.default: value of the ESPRESSO_TMPDIR environment variable if set; current directory ('./') otherwise

var.name: seedname
var.info: Seedname for the wannier90 calculation.

var.name: spin_component
var.info: Spin component. 'up': spin up for collinear spin calculation 'down': spin down for collinear spin calculation 'none': for no-spin or non-collinear calculation

var.name: wan_mode
var.info: 'standalone': for standalone execution of wannier90 'library': for wannier90 library mode

var.name: write_unk
var.info: if .TRUE. write the periodic part of the Bloch functions in real space for plotting the Wannier functions in wannier90.

var.name: reduce_unk
var.info: if .TRUE. reduce file-size (and resolution) of the real-space Bloch functions by a factor of reduce_unk_factor along each direction. Only relevant if write_unk = .true.

var.name: reduce_unk_factor
var.info: The reduction factor per direction for reduce_unk. Default 2 means a reduction of 2x2x2 = 8 of the total number of grid points. Only relevant if write_unk = .true.

var.name: wvfn_formatted
var.info: if .TRUE. write the wavefunctions in Fortran formatted form. Only relevant if write_unk = .true.

var.name: write_amn
var.info: Set to .false. if A(k) is not required.

var.name: scdm_proj
var.info: Set to .true. to compute amn using the SCDM projection.

var.name: scdm_entanglement
var.info: 'isolated': use SCDM for isolated bands. 'erfc': use erfc function as the SCDM occupation for entanglement bands. 'gaussian': use gaussian function as the SCDM occupation for entanglement bands.

var.name: scdm_mu
var.info: Set to the chemical potential for the SCDM occupation. Only relevant if scdm_entanglement = 'erfc' or 'gaussian'.

var.name: scdm_sigma
var.info: Set to the smearing for the SCDM occupation. Only relevant if scdm_entanglement = 'erfc' or 'gaussian'.

var.name: atom_proj
var.info: Set to .true. to compute amn using the pseudo-atomic wavefunctions from pseudopotentials as the initial projection.

dimension.name: atom_proj_exclude
dimension.info: Set to the index of the pseudo-atomic wavefunctions to be excluded from the initial projection. This is useful for excluding the semicore states from the initial projection. Only relevant if atom_proj = .true.

var.name: atom_proj_ext
var.info: Set to .true. to use the external pseudo-atomic wavefunctions from the files stored in atom_proj_dir as the initial projection. Only relevant if atom_proj = .true.

var.name: atom_proj_dir
var.info: Set to the directory containing the external pseudo-atomic wavefunctions. The file names should be of the form SPECIES.dat, where SPECIES is the species name of the atom. For more details, see the wannier90 user guide and examples. Only relevant if atom_proj_ext = .true.

var.name: atom_proj_ortho
var.info: Set to .true. to orthonormalize the pseudo-atomic wavefunctions before computing the inner product between Bloch states and the pseudo-atomic wavefunctions. It is recommended to keep this to .true., set it to .false. only if you know what you are doing. Only relevant if atom_proj = .true.

var.name: write_mmn
var.info: Set to .false. if M(k,b) is not required.

var.name: write_spn
var.info: Set to .true. to write out the matrix elements of spin operator S between Bloch states (non-collinear spin calculation only).

var.name: spn_formatted
var.info: Set to .true. to write spn data as a formatted file. Only relevant if write_spn = .true.

var.name: write_uHu
var.info: Set to .true. to write out the matrix elements of < unk+b1 | Hk | umk+b2 >.

var.name: uHu_formatted
var.info: Set to .true. to write uHu data as a Fortran formatted file. Only relevant if write_uHu = .true.

var.name: write_uIu
var.info: Set to .true. to write out the matrix elements of < unk+b1 | umk+b2 >.

var.name: uIu_formatted
var.info: Set to .true. to write uIu data as a Fortran formatted file. Only relevant if write_uIu = .true.

var.name: write_sHu
var.info: Set to .true. to write out the matrix elements of < unk | s H | umk+b >, which is used in the Ryoo's method to compute spin Hall conductivity. For more details, see the wannier90 user guide and examples.

var.name: sHu_formatted
var.info: Set to .true. to write sHu data as a Fortran formatted file. Only relevant if write_sHu = .true.

var.name: write_sIu
var.info: Set to .true. to write out the matrix elements of < unk | s | umk+b >, which is used in the Ryoo's method to compute spin Hall conductivity. For more details, see the wannier90 user guide and examples.

var.name: sIu_formatted
var.info: Set to .true. to write sIu data as a Fortran formatted file. Only relevant if write_sIu = .true.

var.name: write_unkg
var.info: Set to .true. to write the first few Fourier components of the periodic parts of the Bloch functions.

var.name: irr_bz
var.info: Set to .true. to use irreducible BZ for computing amn/mmn/eig files. To differentiate from the standard full BZ case, the files will use the extension names iamn/immn/ieig, respectively. For more details, see the wannier90 user guide and examples.

var.name: write_dmn
var.info: Set to .true. to construct symmetry-adapted Wannier functions.

var.name: read_sym
var.info: Set to .true. to customize symmetry operations to be used in symmetry-adapted mode. When read_sym = .true., an additional input seedname.sym is required. Only relevant if write_dmn = .true.
